channel.title: Omfg help stupid error!
channel.description:
'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. press any key to continue... :eek:
what the f**k do i do!??!!?
i use v0id-pkz server as my source, and this is what my run server.bat says
@echo off java -classpath rscd.jar;lib/xpp3.jar;lib/xstream.jar;lib/hex-string.jar;lib/mail.jar;lib/activation.jar;lib/jmf.jar org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient pause
[font=Verdana][i][b]please help!!![/b][/i][/font]

item.title: Omfg help stupid error!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:31, topic:241458”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=317810.msg2521055#msg2521055 date=1225858520]

already changed them i show u what’s in it

classpath:CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

path:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

Rofl listen to him… you obviously dont know what you’re doing… if you don’t know what variable are idk if you need to be a coder.

Variable’s don’t have anything to do with coding…unless your using c or c++ or batch or something like that but java is different…you don’t have to know shit to code java…well you do have to know how to open and close brackets…like so

public void brackets {
if playerRights > 0 {
sendMessage("oh jesus brackets");
sendMessage("time to close em up");
        }
   }

[/quote]Wrong actually, variables are a very important part of java. You don’t have to know anything to leech, but you have to know to do REAL coding.[/quote]

i havent done anything with classpaths since i set them up for javac and i haven’t done anything with them besides compile with the javac…so…yea it doesn’t have much to do with it. i can still compile and run my server without classpaths…i have to do it manually without them witch sucks.

Read full topic

item.title: Omfg help stupid error!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“anc13ntpk3r, post:17, topic:241458”]this is really the only problem im having,

this is my java version

jdk 1.5.0_10[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 04, 2008, 10:21:31 pm[/size][hr]i seriously have always had problems with this exactly, and i’ve just never had anyone to help me so ya… please just help me to do this one thing…[/quote]

are you sure its not jdk 1.6.0_10 ??? becase jdk 1.5.0_10 is about a year and a half old…

also set your variables to

classpath:CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

path:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin;

kihomura:

God I’m getting sick of these topics.

Agreed.
